results.title: Black berries
results.creator_credit: Ema Mulholland, Rosie Travers and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Black Berries is a story about Candy and Lao, two 12 year old best friends. One fateful day while walking home, the girls come to a laneway - the short cut. Lao begins to walk down it but, in a moment of loyalty, Candy keeps a promise she made to her mother and chooses the long way home.
Cast includes Anne Louise Lambert.

results.title: Afterlife
results.creator_credit: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Dean Francis and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A female flight attendant on a trans-pacific flight asks the question, “What would you do with the last five minutes of your life?” And sees it answered in the worst-case scenario.
Cast includes Lisa Hensley.

group_siblings.title: Tell your Story: AFTRS cinema trailer

results.title: A Message from the party
results.brief_description: Vivien spends his days plotting revolution and planning his manifesto for takeover. Part satire, part mock-documentry, this short cleverly uses ‘found’ super 8 footage to chart one man’s mania and the power struggles that take place on the domestic front.

results.title: Emit
results.brief_description: Emit is a clock brought to life by the Voyager space probe’s final plummet to the surface of a post-apocalyptic, rubbish covered planet not disimilar to our own. Emit stopped at 11:55, as did the rest of the planet. Now he is ticking again, he sets out to find life and discover what makes it tick. But not everything is what it seems.

results.title: Back fire
results.brief_description: Elli the Elephant is desperate, dateless and bored watching Backfire, a feature drama where a hunky fire fighting elephant saves a damsel in distress from a towering inferno and takes her off for a sunset romance. After noticing a box of matches and full waste paper bin, she has an idea. What follow is a comedy of errors when the hunky fire fighting elephants end up proving to be bungling fools and she ends up having to save the day.

results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS

results.title: The Saviour
results.creator_credit: Stuart Parkyn, Peter Templeman and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Malcolm is a gentle, effective door-to-door evangelist who is in love with a married woman. With pressure mounting from his church to convert her, Malcolm decides his bible is the very weapon he needs to destroy the marriage that is keeping him from his true love. Grand Jury Prize for Best Narrative Short, Slamdance Film Festvial, Park City, USA, 2006
Cast includes Thomas Campbell, Susan Prior, David Somerville, Rhys Muldoon, Nicholas Hammond.

results.title: Butterfly man
results.creator_credit: Justin Davies, Samantha Rebillet and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The evolutionary tale of Don Herbison-Evans, a man who studies butterflies then experiences a human metamorphosis on the dance floor. A warm-hearted documentary that beautifully illustrates an aspect of the human experience.
